title: How much a caricature artist earn? - Quora

response.answer_text: Enough to live, thrive and be "successful," whatever that is.... I know the rough yearly incomes from friends and acquaintances who make their entire income from drawing caricatures for companies that rent spaces at theme parks - they make anywhere from 15–30 grand and maybe another 3–6 grand drawing at events. 60–100 grand and up is doable for individuals at non-theme park locations that have steady, non-seasonal clientele. 40–80 grand and up for caricature artists who travel from fair to fair nationwide, setting up caricature booths at each location. 40–80 grand for caricature artists who entertain at events in areas with large populations, and 20–30 grand in less populated areas. These are my general estimates based on working for one year at Seaworld and 22 years working as an independent entertainer and illustrator in Southern California…
